thread.section_title: Archive News & Video for Monday, 26 Feb 2018 | Reuters.com
thread.title: BRIEF-Moody's Says UK Economy Grew At Slightly Slower Pace In Early 2018, Survey Data Suggest

author: Reuters Editorial
title: BRIEF-Moody's Says UK Economy Grew At Slightly Slower Pace In Early 2018, Survey Data Suggest
text:
Feb 26 (Reuters) - Moody‘s:
* MOODY‘S SAYS UK ECONOMY GREW AT A SLIGHTLY SLOWER PACE IN EARLY 2018, SURVEY DATA SUGGEST, AND RETAIL SALES REMAINED SLUGGISH IN JANUARY
* MOODY‘S SAYS EMPLOYMENT GROWTH SOFTENED IN DECEMBER IN UK, BUT REMAINS FIRMLY POSITIVE, WHILE VOLATILITY HAS INCREASED IN RECENT MONTHS
* MOODY‘S SAYS DIFFERENCES IN SOME KEY AREAS PERSIST BETWEEN UK GOVERNMENT & EU, POSING CHALLENGE TO UK‘S HOPES OF AGREEMENT ON TRANSITIONAL ARRANGEMENT IN MARCH Source text for Eikon:
